title: 2. How to do OR queries in Django ORM? - Books by Agiliq

title: Django or Flask? Recommendation From My Experience.
content: Django is absolutely great for building a full web application in Python. Though you can certainly do some lower-level things with Django, I think for a lot of people Django shines in the form of quick development and Django's auth/permission system that is baked into the package itself.

title: How difficult is deployment with Django or FastAPI?
content: Even though I mostly develop with Python and I know Django pretty well, I've been using PHP because it's so cheap and easy to deploy. I just upload my stuff to a managed server ($10/mo for unlimited domains, super easy to upgrade if necessary), and it runs. If it doesn't run, I contact support, and they help get it running, usually in under an hour. I've left sites running for years and never had issues - deployment takes practically zero money and less than an hour at start-up, and that's it...

content: Django's role in forms¶. Handling forms is a complex business.
